Package gov.nist.secauto.decima.xml.document

Class AbstractXPathEvaluator<FACTORY extends XPathFactory>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.secauto.decima.xml.document.AbstractXPathEvaluator<FACTORY>
  • Type Parameters:
    FACTORY - the type of the XPathFactory to use
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    XPathEvaluator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JDOMBasedXPathEvaluator
    public abstract class AbstractXPathEvaluator<FACTORY extends XPathFactory>
extends Object
implements XPathEvaluator
    This class provides convenience methods for evaluating XPath expressions using a provided XPathFactory.

      • getNamespaceContext

        public NamespaceContext getNamespaceContext()
        Retrieves the NamespaceContext from the underlying XPath instance.

        Retrieves an object that can be used for processing namespace contexts.

        Specified by:
        getNamespaceContext in interface XPathEvaluator
        Returns:
        the current namespace context handler in effect, or null if no handler is in effect.
        See Also:
        XPath.getNamespaceContext()

      • setNamespaceContext

        public void setNamespaceContext​(XPathNamespaceContext nsContext)
        Sets the NamespaceContext in the underlying XPath instance.

        Used to set handler for prefix-to-namespace mapping and other related operations. The utility class XPathNamespaceContext must be used to define namespace mappings.

        Specified by:
        setNamespaceContext in interface XPathEvaluator
        Parameters:
        nsContext - the new namespace context to use that will replace the existing context handler
        See Also:
        XPath.setNamespaceContext(NamespaceContext)

      • getXPathVariableResolver

        public XPathVariableResolver getXPathVariableResolver()
        Retrieves the XPathVariableResolver from the underlying XPath instance.

        Retrieves the resolver used to process XPath variables.

        Specified by:
        getXPathVariableResolver in interface XPathEvaluator
        Returns:
        the current variable resolver in effect, or null if no resolver is in effect.
        See Also:
        XPath.getXPathVariableResolver()

      • setXPathVariableResolver

        public void setXPathVariableResolver​(XPathVariableResolver resolver)
        Sets the XPathVariableResolver in the underlying XPath instance.

        Set a user provided XPath variable resolver that can be used to resolve variables that appear in XPath statements.

        Specified by:
        setXPathVariableResolver in interface XPathEvaluator
        Parameters:
        resolver - the new variable resolve to use that will replace the existing resolver
        See Also:
        XPath.setXPathVariableResolver(XPathVariableResolver)

      • evaluateCompiled

        protected abstract Object evaluateCompiled​(XPathExpression xe,
                                           QName returnType)
                                    throws XPathExpressionException
        Evaluates an XPath expression. Callers of this method are expected to ensure that this method is called in a thread-safe context.
        Parameters:
        xe - the XPath expression to evaluate
        returnType - the expected object type of the return value
        Returns:
        the XPath result
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurs while evaluating the XPath expression

      • evaluateInternal

        protected <T> T evaluateInternal​(String expression,
                                 QName returnType)
                          throws XPathExpressionException
        Used to compile and evaluate all XPath expressions. The returnType is a constant from XPathConstants.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to be returned as the evaluation result
        Parameters:
        expression - the XPath expression to compile and evaluate
        returnType - the expected object type of the return value
        Returns:
        the evaluation result
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - If an error occurred while compiling or evaluating the XPath expression

      • evaluateSingle

        public <T> T evaluateSingle​(String xpath,
                            org.jdom2.filter.Filter<T> filter)
                     throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        Evaluates an XPath expression, returning a single node result matching the provided filter. A filter can be created using the Filters class.
        Specified by:
        evaluateSingle in interface XPathEvaluator
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to be filtered against when determining the result
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to evaluate
        filter - the filter to use to limit the returned result, or null if no filter is to be applied
        Returns:
        the matching result, or null if no result matched
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurred while evaluating the XPath expression

      • evaluateSingle

        public <T> T evaluateSingle​(String xpath,
                            QName returnType,
                            org.jdom2.filter.Filter<T> filter)
                     throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        Evaluates an XPath expression, returning a single node result matching the provided filter. A filter can be created using the Filters class.
        Specified by:
        evaluateSingle in interface XPathEvaluator
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to be filtered against when determining the result
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to evaluate
        returnType - the expected object type of the return value, which is one of XPathConstants
        filter - the filter to use to limit the returned result, or null if no filter is to be applied
        Returns:
        the matching result, or null if no result matched
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurred while evaluating the XPath expression

      • evaluate

        public <T> List<T> evaluate​(String xpath,
                            org.jdom2.filter.Filter<T> filter)
                     throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        Evaluates an XPath expression, returning a list of node results matching the provided filter. A filter can be created using the Filters class.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface XPathEvaluator
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to be filtered against when building the result set
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to evaluate
        filter - the filter to use to limit the returned results, or null if no filter is to be applied
        Returns:
        a non-null result
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurred while evaluating the XPath expression

      • evaluate

        public <T> List<T> evaluate​(String xpath,
                            QName returnType,
                            org.jdom2.filter.Filter<T> filter)
                     throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        Evaluates an XPath expression, returning a list of node results matching the provided filter. A filter can be created using the Filters class.
        Specified by:
        evaluate in interface XPathEvaluator
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of object to be filtered against when building the result set
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to evaluate
        returnType - the expected object type of the return value, which is one of XPathConstants
        filter - the filter to use to limit the returned results, or null if no filter is to be applied
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • test

        public boolean test​(String xpath)
             throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        Evaluates an XPath expression, returning a boolean result indicating if a non-empty result was found matching the XPath expression.
        Specified by:
        test in interface XPathEvaluator
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if at least one match to the expression was found, or false otherwise
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurred while evaluating the XPath expression

      • getContext

        public XPathContext getContext​(String xpath)
                        throws XPathExpressionException
        Description copied from interface: XPathEvaluator
        The method will return the Context, the location within an XML document, for a provided XPath expression. The provided XPath expression must evaluate to a single Content or Attribute result.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface XPathEvaluator
        Parameters:
        xpath - the XPath expression to find the context for
        Returns:
        the context of the evaluated XPath expression result
        Throws:
        XPathExpressionException - if an error occurred while evaluating the XPath expression
